01722 
01724 void AsymCalculator::CalcLongiChAsym(DrawObjContainer *oc)
01725 {
01726    TH2 *hChVsTimeDiff_Up   = (TH2*) oc->o["hChVsLongiTimeDiff_up"];
01727    TH2 *hChVsTimeDiff_Down = (TH2*) oc->o["hChVsLongiTimeDiff_down"];
01728 
01729    TH1 *hAsym          = (TH1*) oc->o["hLongiChAsym"];
01730 
01731    for (int iTimeDiff=1; iTimeDiff<=hAsym->GetNbinsX(); iTimeDiff++)
01732    {
01733       TH1I *hUp   = (TH1I*) hChVsTimeDiff_Up  ->ProjectionY("hUp",   iTimeDiff, iTimeDiff);
01734       TH1I *hDown = (TH1I*) hChVsTimeDiff_Down->ProjectionY("hDown", iTimeDiff, iTimeDiff);
01735 
01736       // Check if there are events in the histograms
01737       if (!hUp->Integral() && !hDown->Integral()) continue;
01738 
01739       TH1D* hChAsym = CalcChannelAsym(*hUp, *hDown);
01740 
01741       TFitResultPtr fitres = FitChAsymSine(*hChAsym);
01742 
01743       if (fitres.Get()) {
01744 
01745          Double_t val = fitres->Value(0);
01746          Double_t err = fitres->FitResult::Error(0);
01747 
01748          hAsym->SetBinContent(iTimeDiff, val);
01749          hAsym->SetBinError(iTimeDiff, err);
01750 
01751       } else {
01752          Error("AsymCalculator::CalcLongiChAsym", "Fit error...");
01753       }
01754    }
01755 
01756 }
01757 
01758 
01763 void AsymCalculator::CalcStripAsymmetry(int Mode)
01764 {
01765    //ds : Overwrite nCounts array
01766    long nCountsUp[N_SILICON_CHANNELS];
01767    long nCountsDown[N_SILICON_CHANNELS];
01768 
01769    // only for Mode < 100
01770    if (Mode < 100) {
01771 
01772       TH2I* hSpinVsChannel = (TH2I*) gAsymRoot->fHists->d["std"]->o["hSpinVsChannel"];
01773 
01774       for (UShort_t iChId=1; iChId<=hSpinVsChannel->GetNbinsX(); iChId++) { // channels
01775 
01776          if ( gMeasInfo->IsDisabledChannel(iChId) ) {
01777             nCountsUp[iChId-1]   = 0;
01778             nCountsDown[iChId-1] = 0;
01779          } else {
01780             nCountsUp[iChId-1]   = hSpinVsChannel->GetBinContent(iChId, 3); // y bin # 3
01781             nCountsDown[iChId-1] = hSpinVsChannel->GetBinContent(iChId, 1); // y bin # 1
01782          }
01783       }
01784 
01785    } else if (Mode >= 100) {
01786 
01787       UInt_t iDelim = Mode - 100;
01788       char dName[256], hName[256];
01789 
01790       // loop over strips and update nCounts array content
01791       for (UShort_t iChId=1; iChId<=N_SILICON_CHANNELS; iChId++) {
01792 
01793          if ( gMeasInfo->IsDisabledChannel(iChId) ) {
01794             nCountsUp[iChId-1]   = 0;
01795             nCountsDown[iChId-1] = 0;
01796          } else {
01797 
01798             sprintf(dName, "channel%02d", iChId);
01799 
01800             DrawObjContainer* oc = gAsymRoot->fHists->d["std"]->d.find(dName)->second;
01801 
01802             sprintf(hName, "hSpinVsDelim_ch%02d", iChId);
01803 
01804             TH1* hSpinVsDelim = (TH1*) oc->o[hName];
01805 
01806             nCountsUp[iChId-1]   = hSpinVsDelim->GetBinContent(iDelim+1, 3); // y bin # 3
01807             nCountsDown[iChId-1] = hSpinVsDelim->GetBinContent(iDelim+1, 1); // y bin # 1
01808          }
01809       }
01810    }
01811 
01812    // Strip-by-Strip Asymmetries
01813    float  Asym[N_SILICON_CHANNELS],        dAsym[N_SILICON_CHANNELS];        // Raw Asymmetries strip-by-strip
01814    float  rawPol[N_SILICON_CHANNELS],      rawPolErr[N_SILICON_CHANNELS];
01815    float  AsymPhiCorr[N_SILICON_CHANNELS], dAsymPhiCorr[N_SILICON_CHANNELS]; // Phi corrected Asymmetries strip-by-strip
01816    float  P[N_SILICON_CHANNELS],           dP[N_SILICON_CHANNELS];           // Strip phi corrected polarization
01817    float  Pt[N_SILICON_CHANNELS],          dPt[N_SILICON_CHANNELS];          // Strip phi truncated corrected polarization,
01818    UInt_t totalUpCounts[N_SILICON_CHANNELS];
01819    UInt_t totalDownCounts[N_SILICON_CHANNELS];
01820 
01821 
01822    for (int iCh=0; iCh<N_SILICON_CHANNELS; iCh++)
01823    {
01824       Asym[iCh]          = dAsym[iCh]        = 0;
01825       AsymPhiCorr[iCh]   = dAsymPhiCorr[iCh] = 0;
01826       rawPol[iCh]        = rawPolErr[iCh]    = 0;
01827       totalUpCounts[iCh] = totalDownCounts[iCh] = 0;
01828 
01829       // Loop to get total counts (luminosity)
01830       for (int j=0; j<N_SILICON_CHANNELS; j++) {
01831 
01832          // Calculate luminosity. This strip and ones in cross geometry are excluded.
01833          if (!AsymCalculator::IsExclusionCandidate(iCh, j)) {
01834             totalUpCounts[iCh]   += nCountsUp[j];
01835             totalDownCounts[iCh] += nCountsDown[j];
01836          }
01837       }
01838 
01839       // Calculate raw asymmetries for the iCh-th strip
01840       if ( totalUpCounts[iCh] && totalDownCounts[iCh] && nCountsUp[iCh] + nCountsDown[iCh] ) {
01841 
01842          // Calculate Asym and dAsym
01843          ValErrPair chAsym = CalcAsym(nCountsUp[iCh], nCountsDown[iCh], totalUpCounts[iCh], totalDownCounts[iCh]);
01844 
01845          Asym[iCh]  = chAsym.first;
01846          dAsym[iCh] = chAsym.second;
01847 
01848       } else {
01849           Asym[iCh] = 0;
01850          dAsym[iCh] = 1e6;
01851       }
01852 
01853       // Since this is the recoil asymmetries, flip the sign of asymmetry
01854       Asym[iCh] *= -1;
01855 
01856       // Asymmetry with sin(phi) correction
01857        AsymPhiCorr[iCh] = Asym[iCh] / sin(-gPhi[iCh]);
01858       dAsymPhiCorr[iCh] = fabs( dAsym[iCh] / sin(-gPhi[iCh]) );
01859 
01860       // Raw polarization without phi angle weighted A_N
01861       //assert(gAnaMeasResult->A_N[1] != 0);
01862 
01863       rawPol[iCh]    =  Asym[iCh] / gAnaMeasResult->A_N[1];
01864       rawPolErr[iCh] = dAsym[iCh] / gAnaMeasResult->A_N[1];
01865 
01866       // Polarization with sin(phi) correction
01867        P[iCh] = rawPol[iCh] / sin(-gPhi[iCh]);
01868       dP[iCh] = fabs(rawPolErr[iCh] / sin(-gPhi[iCh]));
01869 
01870       // Polarization with trancated sin(phi) correction
01871        Pt[iCh] = rawPol[iCh] / sin(-phit[iCh]);
01872       dPt[iCh] = fabs(rawPolErr[iCh] / sin(-phit[iCh]));
01873 
01874       // ds temp fix: assign huge errors to disabled strips
01875       if ( gAsymRoot->fEventConfig->fCalibrator->GetFitStatus(iCh+1) != kDLFIT_OK ||
01876            gMeasInfo->IsDisabledChannel(iCh+1) )
01877       {
01878 
01879          Asym[iCh]  =  rawPol[iCh] =  P[iCh] =  Pt[iCh] = 0;
01880          AsymPhiCorr[iCh] = 0;
01881          dAsym[iCh] = rawPolErr[iCh] = dP[iCh] = dPt[iCh] = 1e6;
01882          dAsymPhiCorr[iCh] = 1e6;
01883 
01884       }
01885    }
01886 
01887    // printing routine
01888    if (false) {
01889       printf("*========== strip by strip =============\n");
01890 
01891       for (int i=0; i<N_SILICON_CHANNELS; i++) {
01892          printf("%4d", i);
01893          printf("%12.5f", gPhi[i]);
01894          printf("%12.5f %12.5e", Asym[i],   dAsym[i]);
01895          printf("%12.5f %12.5e", rawPol[i], rawPolErr[i]);
01896          printf("%12.5f %12.5e", P[i],      dP[i]);
01897          printf("%12.5f %12.5e", Pt[i],     dPt[i]);
01898          printf("\n");
01899       }
01900 
01901       printf("*=======================================\n");
01902       printf("\n");
01903    }
01904 
01905    // Caluclate Weighted Average
01906    Double_t polar, polarErr;
01907    utils::CalcWeightedMean((Double_t*) P, (Double_t*) dP, N_SILICON_CHANNELS, polar, polarErr);
01908    gAnaMeasResult->P[0] = polar;
01909    gAnaMeasResult->P[1] = polarErr;
01910 
01911    // Fit polarization vs phi distributions
01912    if (Mode < 100) { // Fit everything other than scan data
01913 
01914       gAsymCalculator.SinPhiFit(gAnaMeasResult->P[0], rawPol, rawPolErr,
01915          gAnaMeasResult->sinphi[Mode].P, gAnaMeasResult->sinphi[Mode].dPhi, gAnaMeasResult->sinphi[Mode].chi2); // sinphi is filled here
01916 
01917    } else if (Mode >= 100) { // Fit scan data
01918       //gAsymCalculator.ScanSinPhiFit(gAnaMeasResult->P[0], rawPol, rawPolErr,
01919       //   gAnaMeasResult->sinphi[Mode].P, gAnaMeasResult->sinphi[Mode].dPhi, gAnaMeasResult->sinphi[Mode].chi2); // sinphi is filled here
01920    }
01921 }
01922 
01923 
01928 TH1D* AsymCalculator::CalcChannelAsym(TH1I &hUp, TH1I &hDown, TH1D *hChAsym)
01929 {
01930    if (!hChAsym) {
01931       hChAsym = new TH1D("hChAsym", "hChAsym", hUp.GetNbinsX(), hUp.GetXaxis()->GetXmin(), hUp.GetXaxis()->GetXmax());
01932    }
01933 
01934    for (int iCh=1; iCh<=hUp.GetNbinsX(); iCh++) {
01935 
01936       if (gAsymRoot->fEventConfig->fCalibrator->GetFitStatus(iCh) != kDLFIT_OK)
01937          continue;
01938 
01939       UInt_t totalCountsUp   = 0;
01940       UInt_t totalCountsDown = 0;
01941 
01942       UInt_t nCountsUp   = hUp.GetBinContent(iCh);
01943       UInt_t nCountsDown = hDown.GetBinContent(iCh);
01944 
01945       // Loop to get total counts (luminosity)
01946       for (int iCh2=1; iCh2<=hUp.GetNbinsX(); iCh2++) {
01947 
01948          if (gAsymRoot->fEventConfig->fCalibrator->GetFitStatus(iCh2) != kDLFIT_OK)
01949             continue;
01950 
01951          // Calculate luminosity. This strip and ones in cross geometry are excluded.
01952          if (!AsymCalculator::IsExclusionCandidate(iCh-1, iCh2-1)) {
01953             totalCountsUp   += hUp.GetBinContent(iCh2);
01954             totalCountsDown += hDown.GetBinContent(iCh2);
01955          }
01956       }
01957 
01958       // Calculate raw asymmetries for the i-th strip
01959       if ( totalCountsUp && totalCountsDown && nCountsUp + nCountsDown )
01960       {
01961          // Calculate Asym and dAsym
01962          ValErrPair chAsym = CalcAsym(nCountsUp, nCountsDown, totalCountsUp, totalCountsDown);
01963 
01964          // Since this is the recoil asymmetries, flip the sign of asymmetry
01965          chAsym.first *= -1;
01966 
01967          hChAsym->SetBinContent(iCh, chAsym.first);
01968          hChAsym->SetBinError(iCh,   chAsym.second);
01969       }
01970    }
01971 
01972    return hChAsym;
01973 }
01974 
01975 
01977 TFitResultPtr AsymCalculator::FitChAsymConst(TH1D &hChAsym, TGraphErrors *gr)
01978 {
01979    if (!gr)
01980       gr = new TGraphErrors();
01981 
01982    // Create graph from hist to fit
01983    for (int iCh=1; iCh<=hChAsym.GetNbinsX(); iCh++)
01984    {
01985       Double_t bc = hChAsym.GetBinContent(iCh);
01986       Double_t be = hChAsym.GetBinError(iCh);
01987 
01988       // skip the bin if its content and error are both empty
01989       if (!bc && !be) continue;
01990 
01991       bc = bc/(TMath::Sin(-1*gPhi[iCh-1]));
01992       be = TMath::Abs( be/ (TMath::Sin(-gPhi[iCh-1]) ) );
01993 
01994       Int_t nPoints = gr->GetN();
01995       gr->SetPoint(     nPoints, gPhi[iCh-1], bc);
01996       gr->SetPointError(nPoints,           0, be );
01997    }
01998 
01999    // Fit the graph
02000    TF1 *fitFunc = new TF1("constFunc", "[0]", 0, 2*M_PI);
02001 
02002    fitFunc->SetLineColor(kRed);
02003    fitFunc->SetParNames("const");
02004    fitFunc->SetParameter(0, 0);
02005    fitFunc->SetParLimits(0, -1, 1);
02006 
02007    return gr->Fit("constFunc", "S R");
02008 }

02015 TFitResultPtr AsymCalculator::FitChAsymSine(TH1D &hChAsym, TGraphErrors *gr)
02016 {
02017    Info("FitChAsymSine", "Called");
02018 
02019    if (!gr)
02020       gr = new TGraphErrors();
02021 
02022    // Create graph from hist to fit
02023    for (UShort_t iCh=1; iCh<=hChAsym.GetNbinsX(); iCh++)
02024    {
02025       // Skip disabled channels
02026       if (gMeasInfo->IsDisabledChannel(iCh)) continue;
02027 
02028       Double_t bc = hChAsym.GetBinContent(iCh);
02029       Double_t be = hChAsym.GetBinError(iCh);
02030 
02031       // skip the bin if its content and error are both empty
02032       if (!bc && !be) continue;
02033 
02034       Int_t nPoints = gr->GetN();
02035       gr->SetPoint(     nPoints, gPhi[iCh-1], bc);
02036       gr->SetPointError(nPoints,           0, be);
02037    }
02038 
02039    // Fit the graph
02040    TF1 *fitFunc = new TF1("sin_phi", "[0]*TMath::Sin([1]-x)", 0, 2*M_PI);
02041 
02042    fitFunc->SetLineColor(kRed);
02043    fitFunc->SetParNames("Asym", "#phi");
02044    fitFunc->SetParameter(0, 0);
02045    fitFunc->SetParameter(1, 0);
02046    fitFunc->SetParLimits(0, -1, 1);
02047    fitFunc->SetParLimits(1, -M_PI, M_PI);
02048 
02049    return gr->Fit("sin_phi", "S R");
02050 
02051    //delete fitFunc;
02052 }

02054 
02055 // Description : Master Routine for sin(phi) root-fit
02056 // Input       : Float_t p0 (1-par Polarization for par[0] initialization)
02057 //             : Float_t *rawPol, Float_t *rawPolErr, Float_t *phi (vectors to be fit)
02058 // Return      : Float_t *P, Float_t *dphi, Float_t &chi2dof
02059 void AsymCalculator::SinPhiFit(Float_t p0, Float_t *rawPol, Float_t *rawPolErr,
02060                         Float_t *P, Float_t *phase, Float_t &chi2dof)
02061 {
02062    char  htitle[100];
02063    float dx[N_SILICON_CHANNELS];
02064 
02065    for (int i=0; i<N_SILICON_CHANNELS; i++) dx[i] = 0;
02066 
02067    float min, max;
02068    float prefix = 0.3;
02069    float margin = 0.3;
02070 
02071    GetMinMaxOption(prefix, N_SILICON_CHANNELS, rawPol, margin, min, max);
02072 
02073    sprintf(htitle, "Strip asymmetry fit: %s", gMeasInfo->GetRunName().c_str());
02074 
02075    asym_sinphi_fit = (TH2F*) gAsymRoot->fHists->d["run"]->o["asym_sinphi_fit"];
02076    asym_sinphi_fit->SetName("asym_sinphi_fit");
02077    asym_sinphi_fit->SetTitle(htitle);
02078    asym_sinphi_fit->SetBins(100, 0, 2*M_PI, 100, min, max);
02079    asym_sinphi_fit->GetXaxis()->SetTitle("#phi");
02080    asym_sinphi_fit->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("Polarization, %");
02081 
02082    DrawHorizLine(asym_sinphi_fit, 0, 2*M_PI, 0, 1, 1, 1);
02083 
02084    // define sin(phi) fit function & initialize parmaeters
02085    TF1 *func = new TF1("sin_phi", "[0]*TMath::Sin([1]-x)", 0, 2*M_PI);
02086 
02087    func->SetLineColor(kRed);
02088    func->SetParNames("P", "#phi");
02089    func->SetParameter(0, p0);
02090    func->SetParameter(1, 0);
02091    func->SetParLimits(0, -1, 1); // was from 0 to 1
02092    func->SetParLimits(1, -M_PI, M_PI);
02093 
02094    // define TGraphError obect for fitting
02095    TGraphErrors *tg = AsymmetryGraph(1, N_SILICON_CHANNELS, gPhi, rawPol, dx, rawPolErr);
02096 
02097    // Perform sin(phi) fit
02098    tg->Fit("sin_phi", "R");
02099    tg->SetName("tg");
02100 
02101    // Dump TGraphError obect to TH2D histogram
02102    asym_sinphi_fit->GetListOfFunctions()->Add(tg, "p");
02103 
02104    // Get fitting results
02105    P[0]     = func->GetParameter(0);
02106    P[1]     = func->GetParError(0);
02107    phase[0] = func->GetParameter(1);
02108    phase[1] = func->GetParError(1);
02109    chi2dof  = func->GetChisquare()/func->GetNDF();
02110 
02111    delete func;
02112 }
02113 
02114 
02115 // April, 2008; Introduced by Vipuli to keep dphi fixed at gAnaMeasResult->sinphi[0].dPhi[0]
02116 // when doing the fit to data taken at each scaned position
02117 //
02118 // Description : Master Routine for sin(phi) root-fit
02119 // Input       : Float_t p0 (1-par Polarization for par[0] initialization)
02120 //             : Float_t *rawPol, Float_t *rawPolErr, Float_t *phi (vectors to be fit)
02121 // Return      : Float_t *P, Float_t *phase, Float_t &chi2dof
02122 //
02123 void AsymCalculator::ScanSinPhiFit(Float_t p0, Float_t *rawPol, Float_t *rawPolErr,
02124                             Float_t *P, Float_t *phase, Float_t &chi2dof)
02125 {
02126    float dx[N_SILICON_CHANNELS];
02127 
02128    for (int i=0; i<N_SILICON_CHANNELS; i++) dx[i] = 0;
02129 
02130    float min, max;
02131    float prefix = 0.3;
02132    float margin = 0.3;
02133 
02134    GetMinMaxOption(prefix, N_SILICON_CHANNELS, rawPol, margin, min, max);
02135 
02136    char htitle[100];
02137    sprintf(htitle, "Strip asymmetry fit: %s", gMeasInfo->GetRunName().c_str());
02138 
02139    scan_asym_sinphi_fit = (TH2F*) gAsymRoot->fHists->d["run"]->o["scan_asym_sinphi_fit"];
02140    scan_asym_sinphi_fit->SetName("scan_asym_sinphi_fit");
02141    scan_asym_sinphi_fit->SetTitle(htitle);
02142    scan_asym_sinphi_fit->SetBins(100, 0, 2*M_PI, 100, min, max);
02143    scan_asym_sinphi_fit->GetXaxis()->SetTitle("#phi");
02144    scan_asym_sinphi_fit->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("Polarization");
02145 
02146    DrawHorizLine(scan_asym_sinphi_fit, 0, 2*M_PI, 0, 1, 1, 1);
02147 
02148    // define sin(phi) fit function & initialize parmaeters
02149    TF1 *func = new TF1("sin_phi", "[0]*TMath::Sin([1]-x)", 0, 2*M_PI);
02150 
02151    func->SetLineColor(kRed);
02152    func->SetParNames("P", "#phi");
02153    func->SetParameter(0, p0);
02154    func->SetParameter(1, 0);
02155    func->SetParLimits(0, 0, 1);
02156    func->FixParameter(1, gAnaMeasResult->sinphi[0].dPhi[0]);
02157 
02158    // define TGraphError obect for fitting
02159    TGraphErrors *tg = AsymmetryGraph(1, N_SILICON_CHANNELS, gPhi, rawPol, dx, rawPolErr);
02160 
02161    // Perform sin(phi) fit
02162    tg->Fit("sin_phi", "R");
02163    tg->SetName("tg");
02164 
02165    // Dump TGraphError obect to TH2D histogram
02166    scan_asym_sinphi_fit->GetListOfFunctions()->Add(tg, "p");
02167 
02168    delete tg;
02169 
02170    // Get fitting results
02171    P[0]     = func->GetParameter(0);
02172    P[1]     = func->GetParError(0);
02173    phase[0] = func->GetParameter(1);
02174    phase[1] = func->GetParError(1);
02175    chi2dof  = func->GetChisquare()/func->GetNDF();
02176 
02177    delete func;
02178 
02179    // Write out fitting results on plot
02180    char text[80];
02181    TLatex *txt;
02182 
02183    sprintf(text, "(%3.2f +/- %3.2f) * sin(phi %+5.2f +/- %3.2f)", P[0], P[1], phase[0], phase[1]);
02184    txt = new TLatex(0.3, max*0.85, text);
02185    scan_asym_sinphi_fit->GetListOfFunctions()->Add(txt);
02186    delete txt;
02187 
02188    sprintf(text, "#chi^{2} / ndf = %5.2f", chi2dof);
02189    txt = new TLatex(0.3, max*0.7, text);
02190    scan_asym_sinphi_fit->GetListOfFunctions()->Add(txt);
02191    delete txt;
02192 }
